results.title: The Making of the Stooges
results.creator_credit: Mark S Gilman Jr and Operator 13 Productions
results.brief_description: Narrated by Steve Allen, this documentary traces the Three Stooges’ fifty year career from their earliest days as the “Three Lost Souls”. Comprising Larry Fine, Curly Howard, Moe Howard, the Three Stooges developed a wildly unique comic style and were regarded as the kings of slapstick comedy. Featuring rare performance footage and interviews with family, friends and co-workers.

results.title: The Making of the river [B&W]
results.brief_description: Shows how a river forms from many sources: the clouds, melting snow in the mountains and underground springs. It flows throufh canyons and forests, making waterfalls and sometimes quiet pools. Also shows plant and animal life it passes on the journey to the sea, gathering water from joining streams.

results.title: The Making of the President, 1968
results.creator_credit: Fritz Rolano, Robert Abel, Mel Stuart and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Provides a penetrating view of the role played in the 1968 presidential election by the war in Vietnam, student unrest, and uprisings in the inner city areas, as it follows the paths of Richard Nixon, Eugene McCarthy and George Romney. Covers Robert Kennedy’s entry into the race and Lyndon Johnson’s withdrawal, the assassinations of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and Robert Kennedy, rioting and bloodshed in Chicago streets during the Democratic Convention. Concludes with coverage of the election and Richard Nixon’s victory over Hubert Humphrey. Based on the book by Theodore H. White. Editing, David Saxon. Narrator, Joseph Campanella.

results.title: The Making of Star Wars: as told by C-3PO and R2-D2
results.creator_credit: Robert Guenette and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Star Wars is undoubtedly one of the most popular films ever made. Two characters from the film, C-3P0 and R2-D2 lead the viewer on a fascinating behind the scenes look at how the movie was made. Secrets of the special effects are revealed, and the knowledge won’t detract from future viewing of the film. Included in this documentary are excerpts from “Star Wars” featuring Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Peter Cushing and Alec Guinness. Written by Richard Schickel and narrated by William Conrad.

results.title: The Making of Longbird
results.creator_credit: Will Anderson, Donald Holwill, Whiterobot and Edinburgh College of Art
results.brief_description: A ‘mockumentary’ exploration of a young animator’s attempts to bring back to life the legendary lost animated character ‘Longbird’.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 4
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

This video covers the leadup to the first public look of Florence at PAX Australia 2017 of the first public look of Florence. In it, Mountains reflects on about its reception by the public and the game’s upcoming release.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 3
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

These interviews focus on how Mountains developed the musical score and tone of the game, working with game composer Kevin Penkin. This video features behind the scenes footage of the soundtrack’s recording session.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 2
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

These interviews cover the overall creation process for Florence, focusing on how the developer creates a cohesive story through discussions, storyboarding, the art style, the music and the characters.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 1
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

In this series of interviews, the developers at Mountains speaks about the studio’s foundation and introduces the staff, describing itself as a ‘craft game studio’. Florence is introduced as a result of this craft, as the studio seeks to create an aesthetically beautiful and moving piece of art, and not simply a game.
